security_audit.summary: This skill is a pure documentation resource containing troubleshooting guides, diagnostic commands, and decision trees for Claude Code. No executable code, no network calls, no file system access beyond reading its own markdown files. All content is transparent documentation meant to help users debug their Claude Code setup.

content.value_statement: Claude Code extensions, hooks, and agents sometimes stop working. This skill provides step-by-step troubleshooting guides and diagnostic commands to identify and fix common problems quickly. Use it when skills fail to load, hooks do not execute, or agents are not being used.
actual_capabilities: Diagnose skill activation and loading issues
limitations: Cannot execute commands directly on user system
Does not install or update Claude Code

use_cases.title: Skill Not Loading
use_cases.description: When a newly installed skill does not activate despite correct file structure and YAML frontmatter

use_cases.title: Hook Not Executing
use_cases.description: When hooks configured in settings.json fail to run or do not block tools as expected

use_cases.title: MCP Server Issues
use_cases.description: When Model Context Protocol servers fail to connect or tools are not available

prompt_templates.title: Basic Debug Request
prompt_templates.prompt: My Claude Code skill is not activating. How do I troubleshoot this?

prompt_templates.title: Hook Problem
prompt_templates.prompt: My hook script is not executing when tools are used. What diagnostic steps should I follow?

prompt_templates.title: Agent Issue
prompt_templates.prompt: Claude Code is not using my custom agent. How do I verify it is configured correctly?

prompt_templates.title: MCP Debug
prompt_templates.prompt: My MCP server is not connecting. Walk me through the debugging flow to identify the issue.

output: Check if the skill directory exists at .claude/skills/skill-name/
Verify SKILL.md exists with exact capitalization
Confirm YAML frontmatter starts and ends with ---
Ensure name: field matches directory name exactly
Add trigger keywords: Triggers on: keyword1, keyword2
Run: claude --debug and look for skill loading errors

best_practices: Run 'claude --debug' to see detailed loading and permission information
Validate all JSON files with 'jq .' before saving
Test hook scripts manually before relying on them
anti_patterns: Skipping the YAML frontmatter validation step
Using relative paths in hook configurations without $CLAUDE_PROJECT_DIR
Assuming a skill activates without adding specific trigger keywords

faq.question: What tools does this skill use?
faq.answer: The skill uses Bash and Read tools to help you run diagnostic commands and view configuration files.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: This skill provides guidance only. It cannot execute commands on your system or modify your configuration files.

faq.question: How does this integrate with Claude Code?
faq.answer: The skill activates when you describe debugging scenarios. It provides documented commands you run yourself.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads documentation and suggests commands. It never accesses your files or sends data anywhere.

faq.question: Why is my hook not running?
faq.answer: Common causes: script not executable (chmod +x), wrong tool name matcher (case-sensitive), invalid JSON in settings.json.

faq.question: How is this different from built-in debugging?
faq.answer: This skill provides comprehensive decision trees and examples beyond the basic /hooks and /agents commands.
